result.execSummary:
The defendant Damitrie V Howard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
COURT ORDERED TO BE SERVED STRAIGHT TIME, NO RELEASE PRIVILEGES. Court gives credit for 3 days served.
Consecutive to: any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges and assessment, while on probation, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive. Pay all supervision fees. Defendant to make regular monthly payments.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms.
No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no drug paraphernalia, and no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers. Defendant shall be tested twice per month for the first year, and then be tested once per month, randomly. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
AODA assessment and satisfactorily complete any recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes: STAYED, CONSECUTIVE  in the House of Correction to be used by the agent for any violations. Defendant shall serve 10 days for the first violation, 20 days for the second violation, and 30 days for the third violation.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, by 5-5-15, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive. Defendant to make regular monthly payments. Defendant may ask for an extension if making regular monthly payments, and court will grant.

Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work, school, treatment, and meeting with agent. 

REPORT IN DATE: May 22, 2014 by 5pm. If defendant fails to report, ALL COMMUNITY ACCESS IS CANCELLED, and defendant shall serve sentence STRAIGHT TIME, WITH NO RELEASE PRIVIILEGES.
Consecutive to: any other sentence with credit for 3 days time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Damitrie V Howard

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
F&C Commitment issued for failure to pay.   20 days HOC (10 days as to Count 1 and 10 days as to Count 2), consecutive.  
NOTE: Defendant owes $518.00 on Count 1 AND $443.00 on Count 2.  Total balance DUE & OWING is $961.00.
Should have been a Fine & Cost Committment. LJ.
COPY OF NOTICE OF INTENT, court record sheet and judgment of conviction forwarded to the State Public Defender's Office in Madison.pk
records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: NOTICE OF INTENT TO PURSUE POST-CONVICTION RELIEF RECEIVED AND FILED ON 5-19-14.pk
records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Damitrie V Howard in court with attorney Reyna I Morales.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 45 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 3 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work, school, treatment, and meeting with agent.

REPORT IN DATE:  MAY 22, 2014 BY 5 PM.
If defendant fails to report, ALL COMMUNITY ACCESS IS CANCELLED, and defendant shall serve sentence STRAIGHT TIME, WITH NO RELEASE PRIVILEGES.

- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, by 5/5/2015, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.  Defendant may ask for an extension if making regular monthly payments, and court will grant.

AS TO COUNT 1: 
Court sentenced defendant to serve 1 YEAR in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence.  COURT ORDERED TO BE SERVED STRAIGHT TIME, NO RELEASE PRIVILEDGES.  Court gives credit for 3 days served. 
Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS with the following conditions:

- 60 DAYS, IMPOSED and STAYED, CONSECUTIVE in the House of Correction to be used by the agent for any violations.  Defendant shall serve 10 days for the first violation, 20 days for the second violation, and 30 days for the third violation.
- AODA assessment and satisfactorily complete any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no drug paraphernalia, and no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers.  Defendant shall be tested twice per month for the first year, and then be tested once per month, randomly.  
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, while on probation, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.  
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.

Court DENIES defense counsel's request for expungement.  Court feels it is not appropriate.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Sentencing Referral form;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Damitrie V Howard in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 5/5/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3. 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Damitrie V Howard in court with attorney Reyna I Morales.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Discussion regarding Justice Point reports. Defendant is to go to Justice Point immediately after this court hearing. Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing date. Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription. Case adjourned to Branch 03.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Damitrie V Howard in court with attorney Reyna I Morales.  Paul Hauer for Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Damitrie V Howard in court with attorney Reyna I Morales.  Defendant Damitrie V Howard in custody.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
